slides.title: Zero Trust Core Principles
content: Verify explicitly: identity, device, location, behavior, risk.
Least privilege: JIT/JEA, role- and attribute-based access.
Assume breach: segment, egress control, encrypt everywhere.
Continuous evaluation: every request/session, not one-time login.
Policy-as-code: versioned, tested, automated enforcement.
Telemetry-driven: measure, learn, adapt in near real time.

slides.title: Phased Rollout: 90/180/365 Days

0_90_days: Name exec sponsor; form ZT steering committee.
Baseline identity: SSO for top 20 apps; MFA for all users; block legacy auth.
Inventory devices; enroll corp endpoints in UEM; collect EDR posture.
Pilot ZTNA for 3 high-value apps; disable direct inbound to them.
Stand up policy-as-code repo; CI tests; logging to SIEM.
90_180_days: Expand ZTNA to 50+ apps; retire VPN for pilot groups.
Enable risk-based access and step-up for sensitive apps.
Microsegment Tier-0/1 assets; NAC posture for campus access.
Label data; enable email/web DLP; start SaaS tenant hardening.
JIT/JEA for admins; session recording for break-glass.
180_365_days: Service-to-service mTLS; externalize authZ (OPA/XACML) for key apps.
Encrypt sensitive data by default; enforce egress policies.
Automate remediation (SOAR); drill incident tabletop; measure SLOs.
Decommission broad VPN; codify exceptions with review SLAs.

slides.title: Exemplar Policies (Human-Readable)

policy_snippets.name: User-to-App Access
policy_snippets.rule: Permit Finance-App if user in Finance AND device managed+compliant AND risk < High; else step-up with phishing-resistant MFA; else deny.

policy_snippets.name: Privileged Access
policy_snippets.rule: Admins require JIT elevation (2h) with ticket ID; hardware key + re-auth; full session logging.

policy_snippets.name: Device Posture Gate
policy_snippets.rule: Block if OS patch age > 14 days OR encryption off OR EDR inactive; allow ‘limited mode’ to remediation portal.

policy_snippets.name: Microsegmentation
policy_snippets.rule: Deny east-west between Dev and Prod; allow only via API gateway with service identity and mTLS.

policy_snippets.name: Data Exfiltration
policy_snippets.rule: If label=Restricted, prevent external sharing; require encryption; block uploads to unsanctioned domains.

policy_snippets.name: Third-Party Access
policy_snippets.rule: Contractors allowed only to assigned apps from approved countries on managed or attested devices; no Tier-0.

policy_snippets.name: Break-Glass
policy_snippets.rule: Two offline accounts with hardware tokens; notify security on use; auto-expire privileges in 8h.

content.notes: Express as policy-as-code (e.g., OPA/Rego or XACML), version in Git, test in CI, and simulate before enforcement.

slides.title: Common Pitfalls (and Fixes)
content: Tech-first, identity-later -> Fix: start with IdP hygiene, MFA, group/attribute cleanup.
Lifting VPN into ZTNA 1:1 -> Fix: app-by-app access modeled on user/task, not subnets.
Overlooking device posture -> Fix: gate access on UEM/EDR compliance; give remediate path.
Ignoring legacy apps -> Fix: front with ZTNA + header-based auth or app proxies; plan modernization.
Static exceptions that never expire -> Fix: time-bound approvals with owner and review cadence.
No data classification -> Fix: minimal 3-tier labels; automate labeling in pipelines and SaaS.
Under-measured outcomes -> Fix: define KPIs/SLOs; instrument PEPs; weekly review.
Poor change comms -> Fix: UX-first pilots, in-product prompts, helpdesk runbooks/training.

slides.title: Case Study: Global Manufacturer (40k employees)

baseline: Broad VPN access; legacy auth; limited MFA coverage.
Flat east-west in datacenter; minimal device compliance gating.
approach: 90d: MFA for all; SSO for top apps; ZTNA pilot; device inventory.
180d: ZTNA 60 apps; microsegment Tier-0; email/web DLP; JIT for admins.
365d: 90% apps behind PEPs; retire most VPN; service mTLS; automated remediation.
outcomes: Inbound exposure reduced 85% (apps no longer internet-exposed).
Privileged access via JIT 96% of sessions; zero standing admin.
Mean policy eval p95 180 ms; 90% devices compliant (from 54%).
Security incidents with lateral movement down 70%.
